entry.title: Delivery Class for T012
entry.content:
Hi,

We use Customizing synchronization to keep ERP and MDG synchronized. With table T012, we constantly receive a message in MDG that it is on the wrong request type. While a Customizing request is used in ERP, MDG requires a workbench request.

 

A comparison of the delivery classes for table T012 shows that class ‚ÄúC‚Äù (customizing table) is used in ERP and class ‚ÄúA‚Äù (application table) is used in MDG.

Is this a bug or a feature? üòÅ

Is there an SAP note on this?

MDG:

 

ERP:

entry.title: Re: Comparison Between BW and Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi, 

depends on the functionality. BW has been around a while.

I would say, when you compare out-of-the-box features (BW) with limited programming set for do-it-on-your-own (DSP). 

BW/4 has limited connections however. BW 7.x used to have DB-Connect, very powerfull, fast and capable, but the BW/4 version no longer supports such connections, whereas DSP includes the PI capabilities with replication (in/outbound) flows. 

Check the BW docu for more details. 

Cheers, Martin

entry.title: Clarification on Client Dependency of Solution Manager‚ÄìBased Custom Code Management
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

Could you please confirm whether Solution Manager‚Äìbased Custom Code Management (CCLM) is client-dependent or client-independent?

We have multiple clients in our production system, and CCLM is currently enabled for client 000.
Do we also need to activate CCLM in all other production clients?

Best regards,
***


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Client Dependency of Solution Manage...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

In Solution Manager‚Äìbased Custom Code Management (CCLM), the custom code objects themselves are client-independent, whereas the data maintained or collected is client-dependent.

Since you mentioned that CCLM is already activated in client 000, there is no need to activate it again in other production clients unless you specifically require client-specific data collection or analysis.

Best regards,

SAP CCM Support

entry.title: Explore SAP Localization With the Global Map of Local Versions
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs interconnected world, businesses are growing across borders faster than ever. But with global growth comes local complexity ‚Äî from tax regulations to payroll rules and legal reporting.

Whether you're a consultant, developer, or business user, navigating country-specific requirements and features can be challenging. SAP simplifies this journey with the global map of local versions. This interactive application is your one-stop destination to explore SAP-provided local versions across the globe.

In this short video, you‚Äôll see how to navigate the global map of local versions, apply filters, and explore country-specific upcoming regulatory changes in just a few clicks:

 

Ready to explore SAP‚Äôs localization capabilities?
Visit sap.com/localization and go global with confidence.

 

What is a local version?

A local version is a set of system functionalities tailored to meet the legal, regulatory, and business requirements of a specific country or region. Think tax reports, payroll rules, or legal reporting formats ‚Äî all built into SAP solutions to enable compliance and efficiency.

 

Key features of the global map

1. Comprehensive coverage

Explore over 1000 local versions for countries and regions. The global map of local versions simplifies your localization journey by offering a holistic view of SAP‚Äôs localization portfolio.

2. Search & filter

Easily find what you need by filtering the interactive map:

  • By Product: Filter by SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP SuccessFactors, etc.
  • By Country/Region: Select from a list or use the interactive map.
  • By Deployment Type: Cloud, on-premise
  • By Solution Type: SAP, or Partner solution

The map view provides a visual overview, while the list view offers granular details ‚Äî ideal for consultants preparing rollout plans or developers assessing localization gaps.

 

3. Stay ahead of regulatory changes

Direct links to SAP‚Äôs regulatory change manager help you stay informed about upcoming regulations and how they impact your business. These links are prefiltered for you to continue your localization journey and find prospective regulatory changes.

 

4. Find the right SAP Partner

Need additional localization support? Use the SAP-Qualified Partner-Packaged Solution Finder and search for integrated solutions built, sold, and supported by SAP partners that combine SAP software with industry or line-of-business expertise, services, customizations, or applications.

 

5. Deep dive into SAP business solutions

Want to explore further? Use the direct link to the specific SAP product webpage, access dedicated resources and request a demo to expand your SAP landscape.

 

Realize your global potential with SAP

SAP‚Äôs localization capabilities give you the breadth of coverage and depth of expertise to run your business globally ‚Äî while staying locally compliant.

Visit sap.com/localization and take your business global with confidence.

 

Have you used the global map of local versions for your projects? Share your feedback or tips in the comments below.

I am using SAP B1.Can someone please help me with this, When I am trying to getting the session id from the Postman its giving me success response 



But when I am trying to do same thing with .net code its throwing the error 


Here is my code snippet as well

string endpoint = $"{baseURL.TrimEnd('/')}/{version.Trim('/')}/Login";

var payload = new
{
CompanyDB = "SBODemoUS",
UserName = "manager",
Password = "xxxxxxx"
};

string jsonContent = JsonConvert.SerializeObject(payload);
var handler = new HttpClientHandler
{
ServerCertificateCustomValidationCallback = (message, cert, chain, errors) => true
};

var httpclient = new HttpClient(handler);
var content = new StringContent(jsonContent, null, "application/json");
var response = await httpclient.PostAsync(endpoint, content);
if (!response.IsSuccessStatusCode)
{

}

entry.title: Re: UI element - dropdown attribute modification in Fiori
entry.content:
Hi @sagarbasa_22355 

Hope you're doing well üòä

You can achieve this by navigating to:

MDGIMG > General Settings > Data Quality & Search > Search & Duplicate Check > Create Search View
Here, you can modify the standard views: MDGM_MM_ORGS and MDGM_MM_ORGS_CLF.

If you'd prefer not to alter the standard configurations, you can create a completely custom view and adjust it via:
MDGIMG > General Settings > Data Quality & Search > Define Search Application (select your option) > Allocation of Search Help to Search Applications

Best regards,
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Master Data Governance

entry.title: Re: Lower of Cost or Market Valuation for In-House Manufa...
entry.content:
Hi @byd,

the inventory valuation methods always run on the individual material level. A relationship to other materials is not considered. For materials which you do not procure externally, the comparison price will be 0, meaning no revaluation does not happen. You can see if any of the other methods are applicable in your situation (such as inventory costing which you would typically use: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/7f47a6d9441c46ac86c96fd27f6015f0/e149d153c9684608e10000000a174cb4.html?locale=en-US) or you can change material valuation manually (delta or inventory price) after determining the values outside of the system. Keep in mind that you will lose any existing cost component split of the cost estimate if you overwrite the price with a manual one.

Best regards
Marvin

entry.title: SAP Business One Mobile App Configuration & Certificate Hosting Behind Firewall
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I would really appreciate your guidance on this.

I recently implemented SAP Business One for one of my customers, and they have requested access to the SAP B1 Mobile App. I started the configuration by installing B1if, and the database connection was successfully tested ‚Äî everything worked fine until I reached the step in the SAP documentation that mentions certificate installation.

Here‚Äôs where I‚Äôm stuck:
The IT department has informed me that due to their firewall and security policies, they do not want to expose the SAP server to the public internet. They asked me to come back with a secure hosting approach or alternative method that would allow mobile access without breaching security guidelines.

Can anyone please guide me on:

  1. What exactly are the certificates required at this stage?

  2. How can I host the mobile app service URL securely behind a firewall?

Your insights or real-time examples would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your time and support!

Best regards,

entry.title: Extending Entitlements for aem-validation-service-plan Across Subaccounts
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are implementing a CAP service that needs to send and receive events to and from SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM). We have followed the configuration steps described in the official SAP documentation:

CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite - Advanced Event Mesh

 

In our setup, the CAP service is deployed in a different subaccount from the one where Advanced Event Mesh is provisioned. According to the documentation, the configuration requires a service binding to an instance of SAP Integration Suite (aem-validation-service-plan) to obtain the handshake API endpoint (URI).

However, since the AEM instance exists in a different subaccount, it‚Äôs not possible to directly bind the CAP service to this instance.

We would like to clarify:

 

  1. Whether it is possible to extend the entitlements for the subaccount hosting our CAP application to include the aem-validation-service-plan from Advanced Event Mesh.

  2. If such an extension is possible, would there be any additional cost implications associated with enabling this plan in the CAP application‚Äôs subaccount?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,
Oleksii

entry.title: Need to Display Uploaded Image from Custom Table in ABAP Report Output
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have two requirements related to handling images in SAP ABAP :

  1. In a custom screen, users should be able to upload an image, and that image needs to be saved in a custom table. I plan to achieve this by converting the image into an XSTRING (raw string) and storing it in the custom table.

  2. In a custom report, I need to fetch the records from this custom table and convert the XSTRING data back into a viewable image file. In the report output, there should be a file icon field, and when the user clicks on it, the corresponding image should open or display.

My question is:
Is it possible to convert the stored XSTRING value back into an image file and open it directly from the report? If yes, could you please explain how to achieve this or share any sample code?

Thanks in advance,
Kiran

entry.title: SAP B1 Email Alert Configuration
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I‚Äôm currently working on activating Email Alerts in SAP Business One, and I need your help to clarify a few points.

SMTP Connection Issue
When I tried to configure my personal email‚Äôs SMTP settings(FOr Testing Purpose) in the Job Service Portal, I got this error message:

‚ÄúCannot connect to the SMTP server.‚Äù

Could someone guide me on what might cause this error?
What are the prerequisites or checks (like firewall rules, ports, or certificate settings) I should perform before configuring email alerts in SAP B1?

Email Configuration Locations
I noticed that email configuration options are available in both:

  • Job Service Portal, and

  • General Settings (Administration ‚Üí System Initialization ‚Üí General Settings ‚Üí Services tab)

My question is:
Should the email configuration for alerts be done in Job Service Portal or in General Settings?
Why does SAP provide two different configuration areas for email setup?

Any step-by-step explanation or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: API or function to Reject CR of BP in MDG
entry.content:
Hi @Kevin_zzj ,

Hope you're doing well üòä

Note 01: There are multiple ways to implement this, but here's one possible approach:

Within USMD_SSW_DYNAMIC_AGT_SELECT,
use a combination of Service Name, New Step, and Change Request Type to determine the appropriate values.
Then, append the relevant details ‚Äî User Type, User Value, Agent Group, and Step Type to ct_user_agent_group.

Best regards,
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Master Data Governance

entry.title: Re: What are the best practices for migrating data from l...
entry.content: It really depends on the amount of data you need to migrate. Unfortunately for SAP Sales Cloud V2, there are only individual templates for each data object and it is a lot of manual work to map IDs if you chose to do this manually. We did so in our first rollout for two subsidiaries and it was a nightmare. Now we were opting for an Api, but it is not yet ready so we are building something ourselves.

entry.title: Re: MustUnderstand headers are not understood
entry.content: I have a similar problem. Tring to post bulk Journal Entries and my payload can go trough SOAP UI, documents are successfully created. On the other side when I send something from CPI I am getting: "Error Details org.apache.cxf.binding.soap.SoapFault: One or more mandatory SOAP header blocks not understood". In SOAP UI you can control this behavior but in CPI you cannot or I do not know how. In CPI I am using SOAP adapter, with HTTP adapter I am getting 202 but nothing happens in SAP.

entry.title: Re: Test automation tools - Based on type
entry.content:
Good day @KY101 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance:

Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP Cloud ALM

End-to-End Testing with SAP Cloud ALM - Overview, Automated Test Cases

Tricentis Test Automation for SAP integrated with SAP Cloud ALM

SAP provides several native testing tools that are integrated into the Cloud and on-premise ecosystems, while leading third-party platforms extend coverage to performance, security and user acceptance testing.

The right solution will depend on your choice. You need to ascertain:

  • Whether the system is S4H Cloud (Public/Private) or on-premise
  • The level of customization and test automation maturity and
  • Your need for integration across DevOps and CI/CD pipelines.

To summarise, SAP recommends Automation tools depending on the testing type (e.g., unit, integration, Functional, Regression, etc.) you wish to carry out. It also provides tools that cover multiple testing types.

So, your client will have to decide on which ecosystem it wants to build on and based on that evaluate the best possible solution.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Welcome all SAP Community members, start here!
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

Looking forward to be part of the community. I heard about it before, but a guy with a blue beard at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 did an excellent job promoting it üòÑ

I work in the Netherlands, and we use SAP specifically for our insurance administration. I did not know about SAP before starting at my current company 8 years ago. Technically I was in a C# traineeship, but even though I use it for a lot of personal projects, I never got to work with it professionally.

Br,

Jan

entry.title: Re: Where is item that Payment Terms in JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In?
entry.content: As far as I know, if you want to automatically populate Payment Terms, Due Date, and Payment Method when creating an invoice in FB60, you need to ensure that the Field Status Variant for the reconciliation G/L account is set to Optional Entry for these fields. This configuration allows the system to pull the values maintained in the vendor master data into the invoice screen without manual input.

SAP support

entry.title: Re: MSME Identification in Vendor Master
entry.content: Hi, In SAP, MSME details (like MSME Code and Type ‚Äî Micro, Small, Medium) are not standard fields in the Vendor Master by default. You can manage them in a few ways depending on your requirement: Use Custom Fields: Add MSME Code and MSME Type as custom fields in the vendor master (via transaction FK02 or BP in S/4HANA). This can be done through BADI enhancement or field extension (APPEND structure) in table LFA1 or BUT000. Use Classification System: Alternatively, create a vendor classification for MSME type and assign it to vendors under classification view. Use Custom Z-table: Maintain a separate Z-table for vendor MSME mapping and link it to vendor number for reporting and compliance tracking. For long-term identification and reporting, customizing the vendor master data extension (via MM01/MM02 or BP transaction) is the most reliable method. For professional help, consult professionals like Setindiabiz or any other reputed name in the segment!

entry.title: Re: Challenges with Deleting Former Employee Data and Con...
entry.content:
Good day @danifunke 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance:

Data Privacy and Protection, Delete Job, Retention Management, Deletion of Personal Data

To summarise, the Data Protection and Privacy work center controls all person-data handling. Multiple retention periods per ticket type are not yet supported, only one retention rule per business object is allowed in public cloud. You can, however, automate deletion by using:

  • Retention Rules and scheduled Data Deletion Jobs.
  • API-based automation and integrate it with your custom employee-filter report.
  • Alternatively, you can use Anonymization to retain historical ticket data while you remove identifiers.

Based on these options mentioned, I recommend you use the standard retention rule for employees and complement it with SAP Build Process Automation or Intelligent Data Management because it enables dynamic selection.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Error in SAP RAP Documentation
entry.content:

While going through the SAP RAP documentation, I came across something that seems a bit confusing. It mentions that during an unmanaged save scenario, we should not include the persistent table. However in the sample code, a persistent table is mentioned along with unmanaged save. But persistent table is not mentioned in the additional save scenario. It seems like these two cases might have been interchanged.

@Andre_Fischer 

TIA.

This suite encompasses various modules, including Spend Analysis, Sourcing, Contracts, and Supplier Management. Configuring SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing Suite can significantly enhance your organization's procurement processes, leading to cost savings and improved efficiency.

This comprehensive learning experience equips professionals with the skills and knowledge necessary to leverage the full potential of SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing Suite, driving value and innovation for their organizations.

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Talent Intelligence Hub: Custom Attributes for Job Roles Finally Arrive
entry.content:
Based on my experience of  implementing the Talent Intelligence Hub across multiple projects, a recurring client requirement identified during workshops was the ability to map custom attributes to job roles and automatically default them in the Growth Portfolio based on the employee‚Äôs job role. With the 2H 2025 release, SAP SuccessFactors now supports this functionality ‚Äî enabling organizations to map custom attributes created in the Talent Intelligence Hub directly to job roles, thereby enhancing role-based talent insights and development alignment.

Until now, in the Talent Intelligence Hub‚Äôs Growth Portfolio, the only way to default attributes was by using job role‚Äìspecific standard attributes such as Skills and Competencies. With the latest enhancement, this process becomes far more flexible ‚Äî you can now automatically populate custom attributes in the Growth Portfolio based on an employee‚Äôs job role, including the expected rating levels for each attribute.

Steps to configure Custom Attribute Mapping in the Talent Intelligence Hub

  • Data in the screenshot is not real data ,it is taken from Sales demo instance.

To achieve this configuration, follow the steps below:

  1. Create a Custom Attribute
    As an administrator, navigate to the Attributes Library and create a new custom attribute.

  2. Map the Custom Attribute to a Job Role
    Assign the newly created custom attribute to the relevant Job Role of the employee(Demo user)

  3. Validate the outcome under Growth Portfolio
    Navigate to the employee‚Äôs Growth Portfolio to verify that the custom attribute has been automatically populated based on the mapped job role.

Configuration : Demo Employee name - Carl Dixon ; Job role - Craft Worker

Growth Portfolio before the changes :

Configuration Steps :

1.Create a Custom Attribute : Navigate to Manage Talent Intelligence Hub and create custom attribute as below

 

2.Map the Custom Attribute to a Job Role

Navigate to Job Profile Content ‚Üí Select the Role ‚Üí Mapped Attributes (New Mapping Option).

Select your custom attribute from the attributes library  and click on Add

You can even assign the expected rating for this custom attribute as below

Finally save the role .

3.Validate the outcome under Growth Portfolio

Navigate to Employee Charles Growth portfolio to check the auto populated custom attribute with the expected proficiency .

We can see the custom attribute "SF Talent Module expertise" was auto populated with the expected rating.

Benefits of this Feature :

1.With this enhancement, we can now map custom attributes to a job role ‚Äî a capability that was previously limited to standard attributes such as Skills and Competency only.

2. Before this release, if we wanted certain attributes to default in the employee growth portfolio, our only option was to map the job role to skills or competencies. Custom attributes were completely out of scope. With the new functionality, we can now include custom attributes too ‚Äî and set default values for them along with expected ratings.

3. If an organization has some core custom attributes that every employee should possess, we can now leverage this functionality to enforce and track them.

Limitations 

  1. Custom attributes cannot be used in Career worksheet for current Job role or Future role
  2. These cannot be pulled in Job profiles

Note - If you think custom attributes should be available in Job profile please create enhancement requests with SAP.

Let me know if you have any queries on this post.

Thanks

Mridul

entry.title: Job Requisition Approval Reminders
entry.content:
We are trying to set up reminders when users have not completed a job req approval. Ideally, we would like to have a reminder sent to any approver who has had the task for 48 hours and not completed. We have found guidance to use the Manage Form Templates to set up a notification due date, but found that this will only work once and on a specific date in relation to the form creation date. We have several approvers in the workflow, so this solution is not very helpful to the need. 

Are there any alternatives that would base the reminder on how long the task has been with a user, and would potentially work for multiple approvers on the same job?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: US Form I-9 Concepts for SuccessFactors Onboarding 2.0
entry.content:
@BerlindaMensah , @weigoco 

We implemented e-Signature with ONB 2.0 and have discovered that if you check the Remote box and provide a reason then you must download I-9 then complete and sign then upload to Manage Documents.  Clicking the Remote box does not trigger e-Signature for Section 2 of I-9; however, it triggers E-Verify.

The information found in SF (https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-onboarding/implementing-onboarding/form-i-9-remote-data-collection) leads me to believe that if we do NOT have the Form I-9 Remote Data Collection process enabled then we do not have to check "Yes" if new hire is remote.  Do you agree?

Note
Employers using E-Verify for employment eligibility verification can choose to use the alternative remote procedure to verify the employees documentation. This procedure allows the new hire to scan and send PDF copies of their employment eligibility verification documentation to their employer. The employer reviews the documentation and uploads the PDF documents to Section 2, so they are saved in the system.

entry.title: Re: Customer reference copy from service confirmation to...
entry.content:
Good day @daniel_walker 

Thank you for your question.

Considering you are using public cloud, a clean-core approach is vital. Since you want to retrieve the customer reference after billing, maybe consider using I_BillingDocumentItem for reporting.

For pre-billing situation, you can create a Custom CDS View based on I_ServiceConfirmation and associate it to your custom field or business object that stores the reference.

Alternatively, you can expose the filed through Custom Fields and Logic if it is part of the service confirmation business context (SRV_ORD_CONF/SRV_CONF_ROOT).

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance:

Service Confirmation (A2X), Extensibility: Service Confirmation - Create, Change, Extending a Service

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Empowering progress: SAP‚Äôs Learn2Win fuelling growth in Energy & Utilities
entry.content:
At SAP, continuous learning is at the core of our culture and how we deliver customer value. Our twice-yearly Learn2Win program refines solutions, shares real-world experience, and ensures customers benefit from the latest technologies with a future-focused vision.

Last week, I was thrilled to take part in this cycle and see the impact across our teams, partners, and customers.

üåü Learn2Win by numbers

  • 30+ sessions dedicated to Energy & Utilities within a year
  • 12 deep‚Äëdive sessions for the Oil, Gas & Energy and Utilities community last week

üí° Spotlight topics last week

  • Commodity Trading & Risk Management with SAP S/4HANA
  • Shutdown & Turnaround strategies for operational excellence
  • Service procurement best practices
  • AI in oil, gas, and energy‚Äîcurrent use cases and future outlook
  • Gas management approaches and controls
  • Migration methodology and keeping a clean core
  • Optimizing downstream operations with SDM and RFNO
  • The future of field logistics and execution
  • CX for Utilities 

Extending learning beyond the L2W program

‚òïThroughout the year, we host SAP for Energy and Utilities espresso sessions 2 to 3 times a month. These 25-minute webinars offer our partners and customers concise, practical insights into the most pressing industry topics. We encourage our global community to take full advantage of our offerings and contact us for more information.

There's nothing quite like the enriching experience of connecting with peers and experts face-to-face during various industry events throughout the year. The next global event is the SAP for Energy and Utilities Conference, which will take place next April in the charming city of Toulouse.


üì∞Another excellent way to stay informed and inspired - to subscribe to our industry's newsletters for the latest insights in Oil, Gas, and Energy, and Utilities. 

Missed your session? The good news is that we offer most of our sessions on demand!

Colleagues: Please watch the recordings available on the main L2W platform or contact the team.

Partners: L2W recordings will be published to the partner portal shortly.

Customers: Our espresso sessions are available on demand, and we are pleased to share more details or arrange a dedicated one-on-one session to guide you through the insights and next steps.

 

ü§ùThank you to our SAP Energy & Utilities experts and all participating partners for sharing invaluable expertise. A big thank you also to the L2W team for their role in making this program impactful throughout its entire course.

Together, we are transforming insights into action and shaping the future of energy and utilities.

entry.title: PMGM: Dynamic rating visibility
entry.content:
Dear experts & community, 

in context of our Performance Management implementation, we are facing the following requirement from business side: 

During the performance process both employee and manager are supposed to set their ratings on competencies within the performance form (collaborative route map step). The employee should be able to decide whether their self-rating should be visible to the manager or not during the process. In the step for the 1:1 meeting, it should therefore be possible for the self-rating to remain invisible, unless the employee has decided against it. The best solution would be a button "show rating" that controls the rating visibility in the next step. 

As I know, there is no dynamic control of the rating visibility in standard. Does anyone have an idea for a solution/ workaround? 

Kind regards, 

Daniel

entry.title: Re: JOIN US: Meet SAP HANA Cloud @ SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content: Thank u for sharing

entry.title: PMGM: Dynamic Rating Visibility
entry.content:
Dear experts & community, 

in context of our Performance Management implementation, we are facing the following requirement from business side: 

During the performance process both employee and manager are supposed to set their ratings on competencies within the performance form (collaborative route map step). The employee should be able to decide whether their self-rating should be visible to the manager or not during the process. In the step for the 1:1 meeting, it should therefore be possible for the self-rating to remain invisible, unless the employee has decided against it. The best solution would be a button "show rating" that controls the rating visibility in the next step. 

As I know, there is no dynamic control of the rating visibility in standard. Does anyone have an idea for a solution/ workaround? 

Kind regards, 

Daniel

entry.title: An XML output is triggered parallel even if I change the output channel before updating a changed PO
entry.content:
On the supplier under collaboration communication you would not see a standard XML output.

Regardless of that if you maintain XML manually  and save, xml would be selectable.

What happens in the below scenario.

 

Created PO would be send out via XML which is correct and wanted.

for any changed PO your customer do not want to receive any updates. Therefore before send an update to the supplier you change the output in the edit output settings to , do not send, printing, email.

The output would show that the changed PO was sent to the printer but parallel still an xml output is triggered.

This is the expected system behaviour as you bypassing the SAP Standard output.

entry.title: Professional service Projects
entry.content:
Hi,

Our customer is running S4 public cloud and is a professional service company with a lot of professional services projects serving a lot of customers. Those projects has during the implementation project been created as periodic services, however now when we've been understanding more of their business we start to discuss if they should for the future create projects with fixed price instead. However when searching for this we can't really find any clear explanation of which should be used when. Does any body have any real example of how those two types should be used typically? 

We know that based of the contract type we've got a revenue recognition key and that the different contract types consists of different ways of calculating the revenue. 

Kind regards, Sanne

entry.title: Re: BOB - The Business Objects Board
entry.content: The BusinessObjects Board, or BOB, is alive and well, moving to a new platform and domain in the cloud in September 2020. Speak BO is another free community for SAP BusinessObjects users, although it has some paid features that unlock additional content.

entry.title: Re: Proxy operation in BAS
entry.content: The proxy configuration is meant for local testing in BAS and you need to configure the application with an appropriate destination that is referenced in the xs-app.json file.

entry.title: Re: Posting credit memo: Acquisition value will become ne...
entry.content:
HI @Yaya_AB ,

Below are few options to troubleshoot your issue.

AreaDescriptionReason Error Happens (Even for 1 EUR)How to DiagnoseRecommended Solution
Fully depreciated assetAsset‚Äôs depreciation = APCCredit memo would make APC < depreciation ‚Üí negative APCCheck APC, cumulative dep., NBV in Display Asset ValuesPost retirement instead of credit memo or reverse excess depreciation (write-up)
Very low Net Book ValueNBV close to zeroEven small credit pushes NBV negativeReview NBV in Asset ValuesPost retirement or adjust depreciation
Revaluations / impairmentsAPC layers recalculatedOne layer is already at zero ‚Üí credit makes it negativeUse Asset Values ‚Äì Posting View to inspect APC layersUse APC correction posting to adjust layers
Prior partial retirementQuantity or APC already reducedFurther APC reduction violates quantity/APC controlCheck asset history in Asset History Sheet (F1606)Post additional retirement, not credit memo
Depreciation key restrictionsCertain keys block negative base valuesKey does not allow reductions beyond current APCCheck depreciation key in configurationChange useful life, or perform write-up
Useful life expiredRemaining useful life = 0System prevents APC reductions after end of useful lifeCheck useful life in Asset Master ‚Üí Time Dependent DataExtend useful life
Over-depreciationDepreciation posted > APCFurther APC reduction becomes impossibleCompare APC vs cumulative depreciationPost write-up to correct depreciation
Parallel depreciation areasOne area has APC at zeroCredit memo fails across all areasCheck area values in Asset Values ‚Äì Posting ViewAdjust area-specific APC using correction posting
Strict Cloud Edition logicCloud prevents negative APC at any layerValidation stronger than On-PremiseN/A (standard behavior)Use APC correction, or retirement instead of credit memo

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Warranty Claim Form (FDP_WARRANTY_CLAIM_E) Issues in SAP S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôve been working with the FDP_WARRANTY_CLAIM_E form template in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and we‚Äôve encountered several issues that I‚Äôd like to check if others have also experienced.

  1. Data Source Connection:
    Initially, the form would not open properly in Adobe LiveCycle Designer due to a missing XML Schema (‚ÄúRoot element named ‚Äòdata‚Äô could not be found‚Äù). We had to manually reconnect the XSD data source in Adobe to make it work. After that, the form started loading normally.

  2. Master Form Issue:
    I already associate the custom form with a custom master form in CBC, but the Warranty Claim form does not take any master form at all. It doesn‚Äôt use our custom master (which includes our company logo and layout) nor the typical SAP master with the tree logo used by other forms. Instead, it renders with a completely different layout showing a blue SAP logo, as if it contains its own internal master page.

  3. Missing or Empty Fields:
    The form contains very few data fields, and several important ones are empty in the runtime data, especially:

    • Supplier / Business Partner

    • Supplier Address and Contact fields

    These elements are defined in the XSD but come through empty in the form‚Äôs XML data.

üëâ Has anyone else faced this same issue with the Warranty Claim Form (FDP_WARRANTY_CLAIM_E) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
Were you able to make it use the correct master form and populate the supplier details?

Any guidance or confirmation from others who have worked with this form would be greatly appreciated.

I also haven‚Äôt found any way to extend the data source or add custom logic associated with this form to enhance its structure.

Thanks in advance!
Diego

entry.title: Re: How to work with exemptions using ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) in the cloud during development in an
entry.content:
Hi @OlgaDolinskaja ,

We have configured the central ATC checks with the BTP ABAP Environment for the on-premises S/4 Foundation 2023-based system. I can execute central ATC checks from Eclipse, and I can also see the exemption requests in the 'Approve ATC Exemptions' Fiori app in the BTP ABAP Environment. The only problem I am facing now is that the approved exemptions are not being considered in the subsequent ATC runs, and the same approved finding is reported again. I can request exemptions as many times as I want for the same finding with the same checksum. There are no auth or RFC failures.
What might be wrong here?

Regards,
Rishi

entry.title: Data Space Integration Package
entry.content:
Exciting News: Introducing the new data space integration package!

We are pleased to announce the successful release of our new add-on SKU: data space integration package! Officially available on the price list as of October 20th, this milestone reflects our commitment to advancing data space adoption and delivering greater value to our customers.

What does it include?

The data space integration package is designed to enable organizations to securely and efficiently connect supply chain partners within data spaces so that they can exchange data in a secure and sovereign way ‚Äì a key requirement for modern digital supply chains. It contains two powerful components:

  • data space integration, a connector that facilitates smooth, secure and self-sovereign data exchange in data spaces.
  • decentralized identity verification, a wallet that allows businesses to efficiently share trustworthy, verifiable data.

Highlights:

  • Key application areas: Manufacturing-X, Catena-X, Factory-X, Semiconductor-X, Chem-X and supply chain networks in other data spaces.
  • Competitive Pricing: The pricing has been carefully structured to ensure competitiveness, while maintaining SAP‚Äôs high standard of quality. This is initially available exclusively as a single add-on to the Integration Suite Starter Edition, with planned expansion to multi-connector support for all Integration Suite editions starting Q2 2026 (based on our product roadmap).
  • Benefits: The package facilitates data-driven collaboration to optimize production, enhance supply chain visibility and drive innovation, and promotes interoperability amongst partner applications.

Why Is This Important?

The Data Space Integration Package represents SAP‚Äôs ongoing dedication to simplifying data collaboration and helping customers unlock new business models. With global supply chains growing more complex, establishing secure, sovereign, and verifiable data exchange is more critical than ever.

Looking Ahead

We are excited to see how our customers leverage the data space integration package to streamline data exchange and reshape secure collaboration across their partner networks.

For more information about pricing and availability, or to learn how you can get started, contact us.

Stay tuned for more updates on SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs data space capabilities!

entry.title: Re: ALV Background spool open as Excel file

Geoff

"controlConfiguration": {

Karthik

entry.title: Re: Customer reference copy from service confirmation to...
entry.content: Hello Chris, thank you for your reply. For the option: For pre-billing situation, you can create a Custom CDS View based on I_ServiceConfirmation and associate it to your custom field or business object that stores the reference.

entry.title: Re: Material Ledger master data cannot be created for val...
entry.content:
Hi Laxman,
To resolve this issue, follow these steps to ensure all prerequisites are met.

Checklist to Fix FINS_ML_START020
1. Ensure Valuation Area is Assigned to a Company Code Go to transaction OMWB and verify that the valuation area is correctly assigned to a company code.
2. Activate Material Ledger in Customizing Use transaction OMX1 to activate the Material Ledger for the valuation area. Also check OMX2 and OMX3 for currency settings and ledger types.
3.Set Valuation Area as Productive After activation, use CKMSTART to set the valuation area as productive. If this fails, it may be due to missing configuration or open transports.
4. Check for Open Transports or Locks If the company code or valuation area is locked due to open transports (e.g., Q to P), ML activation may be blocked. Refer to SAP Note 2831274 for guidance.
5. Run Production Startup Utilities In some cases, you need to run Production Startup via: Accounting ‚Üí Controlling ‚Üí Actual Costing/Material Ledger ‚Üí Utilities ‚Üí Production Startup This converts material data for ML use.
6.Review SAP Notes for System Conversion Scenarios If you're migrating from ECC or Simple Finance to S/4HANA, follow SAP Note 2352383 for proper ML activation steps.


Use transaction CKM3N to verify if any materials are already using ML. Check material master settings in MM01/MM02 to ensure ML-relevant views are maintained. Ensure currency types are correctly configured for ML in OMX2.

Hope above this will resolve your issue

entry.title: Need CDS View for Ocean Freight Booking Details and Reporting ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are working in SAP Public Cloud Grow Edition and have created freight bookings in the Manage Ocean Freight Booking application.

Now we want to retrieve booking details (i.e., Port of Loading, discharge, Vessel, Voyage and other related fields) for implementing further business solutions, but we are unable to find any released CDS view which can be utilized for the same.

Please guide us by providing the released CDS view from which this information can be retrieved.

We also need CDS views to create queries for reporting purposes, as the current queries are deprecated.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need CDS View for Ocean Freight Booking Details and R...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

  • Retrieving Freight Booking Details (Vessel, Voyage, Port of Loading, etc.)

The necessary booking details are available across the following released CDS Views, which are classified as C1 released (suitable for consumption and custom logic implementation):

  • For Vessel and Voyage: Please utilize the CDS View I_TransportationOrderStage_2.

  • For Port of Loading and Discharge: Please utilize the CDS View I_TransportationOrderStop_2.

As these views are C1 released, you can use them internally within your S/4HANA Cloud environment for implementing further business solutions via Key User Extensibility.

Alternative for External Consumption

If you require this data for external consumption, you can utilize the available Freight Booking API:

Freight Booking API Documentation

  • CDS Views for Reporting Purposes

The same released CDS Views mentioned above (I_TransportationOrderStage_2 and I_TransportationOrderStop_2) are suitable for creating custom analytical queries for reporting purposes, replacing any deprecated queries you may be currently using.

We hope this guidance helps you proceed with your implementations. Please let us know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Content Security Policy: when SAP S/4HANA cares like a mother
entry.content:
Disclaimer: I was made aware of the fact that "don't talk to strangers" is actually not very good advice when it comes to safety of children. Reason:  such advice might prevent kids from seeking help from unknown adults. And situations where seeking help from random strangers is beneficial are more common than cases where talking to strangers is dangerous.

So to avoid any misunderstandings: this blog post is trying to give advice on CSPs, not on child safety. I just needed an attention-grabbing introduction.

entry.content:
I recommend to access our RISE with SAP Methodology and Experience learning journey. 

Understanding the RISE with SAP methodology is crucial for driving business transformation.

Start your journey today!

  • Explain the phases of the RISE with SAP Methodology
  • Apply the recommended tools with SAP Activate to support the RISE with SAP Methodology 
  • Visualize RISE with SAP Methodology outcomes and implementation experience via customer success stories 

Prerequisites

  • You must have served as a consultant, project manager or architect on at least three implementation

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: How to create a Worker via SOAP API in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Pre-requisite:

The Communication Arrangement for the scenario External HR Workforce Integration (SAP_COM_0301), needs to be setup in the Target System.

  1. Create a communication user using the Maintain Communication Users app.
    To create a New Communication User follow the below steps
    1. Go to the New button.

       

    2. Create the New Communication User (For Example I have taken the name ‚ÄúSOAP_API_0301‚Äù. Once you have filled in the required details

       

    3. Create it.
      2. Create a communication system using the Communication Systems app. For more information, refer to Maintain Communication Systems.
      1. Go to the app Communication Systems.
      2. Try to create a new Communication System and fill in the data in the fields (System Id, System Name and the Host name).

        For example: I have taken my Target system as CCF/708. The Host name will be ‚Äúccf-708.devsys.net.sap‚Äù.

         

      3. Now go to the Tab ‚ÄúUsers for Inbound Communication‚Äù and add the newly created Communication User.
      4. The Authentication Method needs to be ‚ÄúUserName and Password‚Äù.
      5. Then Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.
      6. Then Click on ‚ÄúSave‚Äù it.

         

3. Create a communication arrangement using the Communication Arrangement app (SAP_COM_0301).

  1. To create the Communication Arrangement, go to the App ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangement‚Äù.
  2. Click on New.
  3. Put the scenario id SAP_COM_0301.
  4. Click on Create button.
  5. Maintain the New created Communication System (Example: SOAP_API_0301).
  6. Once you maintain the Communication System, the Inbound communication will be automatically populated based on the configuration before.
  7. Then Save it.

Steps to perform to the Worker Creation:

  1. Once the Communication Arrangement is setup correctly in the Target System, we are going to use Bruno to try to push the Payload and create the Worker.
  2. In Bruno, we will create a collection with the required name and the location. (For Example, we are using the collection CC3_708).

     

  3. Once that is done try Creating a New Request on the New Collection.
  4. In creation of the request, put in the Request Name (For Example: Creation of the Worker) with the Type ‚ÄúHTTP‚Äù.
  5. In the URL, the request should be the POST.

     

  6. The Request URL needs to be taken from the Target System from the app ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangement‚Äù from the Inbound Services with the application protocol ‚ÄúSOAP‚Äù.

     

  7. Copy the URL and paste it in here.

     

  8. Then create it.
  9. Once the request is created in the Bruno, it will be showing up like the below screenshot.
  10. Navigate to the Body Tab set the type to be XML.
  11. Then put in the required XML Payload.
  12. Then Navigate to the Tab Header.

     

  13. Add Header with the below values
    Key: Content-Type
    Value: text/xml
  14. Once that is maintained, navigate to the ‚ÄúAuth‚Äù Tab. Change it to Basic Auth from Inherit.

     

  15. Once that is set up you need to take up username and password maintained in the app Communication Arrangement in the Inbound Communication part.
  16. Copy the authentication details (username and password) to the Auth section in Bruno.
  17. Then Save the request and execute it.
  18. Once that is executed correctly, it will show the status 200 OK.
  19. Then check for the Worker with the provided worker id/ Person UUID in the app ‚ÄúManage Workforce‚Äù app.
  20. Now the Worker is created with provided details in the XML and with the Entry Source SOAP API(A).

For any further Information refer to the help documentation below,
Replicate Basic Master Data for Workforce from External HR Systems | SAP Help Portal.
